title: Raymond: 2023 budget proposal allows Space Force to ‘pivot’ to next-generation systems
summary: The U.S. Space Force cannot continue to acquire satellites and deploy constellations the same way it has in the past given the complexities to the current space environment, Gen. John “Jay” Raymond, said April 5.

title: Kendall: Space Force budget boost speaks to the value of space in defense strategy
summary: t a time when critical U.S. satellites are seen as likely targets for hostile attacks, adding billions of dollars to the Space Force’s budget was a necessary move, Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said April 5 in a keynote speech at the 37th Space Symposium.

title: Benchmark to triple production capacity to meet demand
summary: Satellite propulsion startup Benchmark Space Systems announced plans April 5 to triple production capacity to meet growing demand for its Starling and Halcyon propulsion systems.

title: Orbital Reef passes design review
summary: Orbital Reef, a commercial space station being developed by a consortium of companies, has completed an initial design review as part of a NASA award.

title: Japan’s ArkEdge Space closes $18.7 million Series A for nanosatellite projects
summary: Japanese startup ArkEdge Space has raised $18.7 million since this year to continue developing nanosatellite technologies needed for building an Earth-to-moon communication system and a multi-functional smallsat constellation.

title: York Space to triple satellite production to meet military and commercial demand
NASA to Discuss Final Test Status Today Before Artemis Moon Mission
summary: NASA to Discuss Final Test Status Today Before Artemis Moon Mission

title: SpaceX’s upgraded Super Heavy booster sails through first major test
summary: SpaceX’s first upgraded 33-engine Super Heavy booster appears to have passed a crucial test with surprising ease, boding well for a smooth...

title: Amazon signs multibillion-dollar Project Kuiper launch contracts
summary: In the largest commercial launch deal ever, Amazon is purchasing up to 83 launches from Arianespace, Blue Origin and United Launch Alliance to deploy most of its 3,236-satellite Project Kuiper broadband megaconstellation

title: Jeff Bezos and Amazon just hired everybody but SpaceX for Project Kuiper
summary: Huge contracts for United Launch Alliance, Arianespace, and Blue Origin.
